koohiiStory1: The mnemonic "words to seduce the masses" was just too vague and I kept forgetting it. So now instead I picture a seductive female reading aloud the imperial edict to the masses, thus "seducing" the masses.
koohiiStory2: The emperor did not need an imperial edict; his words were more than enough to seduce Anakin to the dark side.

humanum_short_description_en:
From the sound of " speaking " and " calling ", Shang Yang expresses edicts and orders, and Shang Yang measures: "The emperor is the emperor. Ming Yizhi." Also see the term "Imperial Affairs", it is the official office of the Central Government of the Qin Dynasty.

"Shuowen": "Zhao, sue also. From words to call, call also sound." See " Zhao ".
humanum_short_description:
金文從「言」，「召」聲，表示詔令、命令，商鞅量：「立號為皇帝，乃詔丞相狀、綰，灋(法)度量則不壹，歉(嫌)疑者皆明壹之。」又見「詔事」一詞，是秦中央官署，屬少府，五年相邦呂不韋戈：「五年相邦呂不韋造，詔事圖。」

　　《說文》：「詔，告也。从言从召，召亦聲。」參見「召」。

詔字的汉语字典释义

[①]［zhào］
［《廣韻》之少切，去笑，章。］
“诏1”的繁体字。
(1)告知。
(2)教导；告誡。
(3)皇帝下达命令。
(4)引申为被皇帝任命。
(5)诏书。
(6)言。《庄子·人间世》：“若唯无詔，王公必將乘人而鬭其捷。”成玄英疏：“詔，言也。”一说谏诤。陈鼓应今注：“詔，崔譔本作'詻'（è），争辯、諫諍之意。”
(7)辅助。
(8)征召；召集。
(9)引申为招致，导致。
(10)文体名。
(11)古代少数民族首领的称号。
[②]［shào］
［《字彙》市召切］
通“紹1”。“诏2”的繁体字。
承继。
